thread.title: Cops: College student killed by wrong-way DUI driver
thread.title_full: Cops: College student killed by wrong-way DUI driver

author: Raisa Habersham
title: Cops: College student killed by wrong-way DUI driver
text:
A college student was killed Saturday after a wrong-way driver ran a red light and hit the woman’s car, Smyrna police said.
Kimberly Islas, 21, was about five minutes from her home at the time of the crash, Channel 2 Action News reported. Police arrested Casey Taylor, 44, Sharpsburg who had prescriptions drugs in her system at the time.
Casey Taylor, 44. (Credit: Channel 2 Action News) According to an arrest warrant, Taylor was driving her tan 2003 Ford Explorer when she was headed southbound at the intersection of South Cobb Drive and King Springs Road and crossed into the opposite side of the street.
Taylor allegedly struck Islas’s 2001 Honda Civic as she was turning.
“The force of the impact was so great that our victim was ejected out of the (car),” Smyrna police spokesman Officer Louis Defense told Channel 2.
Islas’ family said the Marietta High School graduate was attending Atlanta Technical College preparing to become a nurse.
“It’s just not fair,” Aunt Jessicia Barron said, “It’s not fair. It happens to people who are trying to be on a good path.”
Police: Marietta High grad, 21, killed by 44yo driver who was DUI, going wrong way, ran light; wanted, had no license & long record. @wsbtv pic.twitter.com/HOLQu0S8wK
— Ross Cavitt | WSB-TV (@RossCavittWSB) February 6, 2017 According to police, Taylor was driving on a suspended license for a previous DUI, had no insurance or registration and was driving with a fake tag.
Taylor also had a warrant for her arrest in South Carolina, Channel 2 reported. She remained in the Cobb County Detention Center on vehicular homicide, DUI, and traffic-related charges.
